description: The royal palace of Fish-Man Island, home to the Neptune royal family. Located in the center of Fish-Man Island, it is a grand underwater structure.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Cuts Hody Jones
keyEvents.description: Zoro slashes Hody Jones inside Ryugu Palace, temporarily defeating him before Hody recovers using Energy Steroids.
keyEvents.significance: First major confrontation showing post-timeskip Zoro's strength against the arc's main antagonist.

keyEvents.title: Hody Takes Control of Ryugu Palace
keyEvents.description: Hody Jones successfully captures King Neptune, Zoro, Usopp, and Brook, taking complete control of Ryugu Palace while the Ministers and guards escape.
keyEvents.significance: Major turning point where the antagonist gains control of the kingdom's seat of power.

statusHistory.reason: Palace functioning normally under King Neptune's rule
Hody Jones and the New Fish-Man Pirates take control

description: A mysterious underwater forest on Fish-Man Island where ships and graves rest. It contains coral growing due to light from the Sunlight Tree Eve, and houses important historical poneglyphs including Joy Boy's apology.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Group Arrives
keyEvents.description: Luffy, Shirahoshi, Chopper, and Sanji arrive at the Sea Forest where Franky is working on the Thousand Sunny with Den.
keyEvents.significance: Brings the split crew members together at an important historical location.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Jinbe Reunion
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Jinbe meet for the first time in two years at the Sea Forest, reuniting after their separation following Marineford.
keyEvents.significance: Important reunion setting that serves as a place of both memory and new beginnings.

keyEvents.title: Jinbe's Apology
keyEvents.description: Jinbe apologizes to the Straw Hats at the Sea Forest for his role in releasing Arlong, who terrorized Nami's village.
keyEvents.significance: The Sea Forest serves as an appropriate setting for confronting past mistakes and seeking redemption.
